info.name: Power Source
info.description: Electrical power infrastructure providing stable energy for BERT's computational operations including Rust compilation, Bevy ECS processing, Leptos reactive updates, and Tauri desktop integration with power scaling based on model complexity

info.name: Interactive User
info.description: Human systems analyst using BERT's Leptos-based graphical interface for bounded entity modeling, system boundary definition, and flow characterization through mouse interaction, drag-and-drop operations, and property editing forms

info.name: Data Import User
info.description: Human analyst providing pre-existing JSON system models, external data files, or legacy format conversions for import into BERT's data model layer with automatic validation and format compliance checking

info.name: LLM Assistant
info.description: Large Language Model providing automated content generation, system enhancement suggestions, and collaborative modeling support through BERT's AI collaboration interface with natural language processing capabilities

info.name: Computer Screen
info.description: Visual display system rendering BERT's Bevy-powered interactive visualizations including Entity-Component-System diagrams, real-time model updates, infinite nesting hierarchies, and cubic Bézier flow curves with 60+ FPS performance

info.name: Ambient Environment
info.description: Physical environment receiving waste heat from computational processes during intensive system modeling operations including Rust compilation, Bevy rendering, memory allocation, and GPU-accelerated graphics processing

info.name: Model File Storage
info.description: Persistent file system storage for BERT JSON model files containing bounded entity definitions, system hierarchies, and relationship mappings with version control capabilities and backward compatibility support

info.name: System Export Storage
info.description: File system destination for processed system outputs, analysis reports, screenshot exports, and documentation generated through BERT's hybrid web/desktop architecture with platform-specific optimizations

info.name: BERT
info.description: Bounded Entity Reasoning Toolkit - A self-referential systems modeling application implementing Layer 4 System Language architecture. As Bertalanffy states: 'A system can be defined as a complex of interacting elements where the behavior of elements in relation is different from their behavior in isolation.' BERT embodies this through its sophisticated ECS architecture where Bevy components, Leptos UI elements, and Tauri platform integration create emergent bounded entity reasoning capabilities. Mobus 7-tuple: (Structure=ECS+UI layers, Function=visual systems modeling, History=interaction lifecycle states, Complexity=adaptive component behavior, Boundary=software interfaces, Environment=hybrid web/desktop, Relations=event-driven coordination). This represents the fascinating recursive case where a bounded entity reasoning tool applies its own methodology to analyze itself as a bounded entity system.

info.name: Software Application Boundary
info.description: Multi-layered software boundary encompassing Tauri desktop integration, Leptos reactive UI components, and Bevy ECS visualization engine. Boundaries are enforced through Rust's type system, event-driven architecture, and platform-specific API abstractions supporting hybrid web/desktop deployment.

info.name: Bevy Visualization Interface
info.description: High-performance graphics interface rendering bounded entity models through Entity-Component-System architecture with real-time interaction, infinite nesting support, and automatic curve generation

interfaces.protocol: 1. User interaction captured via mouse plugin → 2. ECS queries identify affected entities → 3. Component state updates calculated → 4. Transform and rendering components updated → 5. Visual display refreshed at 60+ FPS

info.name: Thermal Management Interface
info.description: Heat dissipation interface managing thermal output from Rust compilation, Bevy ECS processing, GPU rendering operations, and memory allocation during intensive bounded entity modeling sessions

interfaces.protocol: 1. CPU and GPU temperatures monitored → 2. Thermal thresholds evaluated against system limits → 3. Performance scaling applied as needed → 4. Heat transferred to ambient environment → 5. Optimal operating temperature maintained

info.name: JSON Persistence Interface
info.description: Data model serialization interface supporting comprehensive JSON persistence with hierarchical data representation, version management, backward compatibility, and data integrity validation

interfaces.protocol: 1. Save operation initiated through UI → 2. ECS world state serialized to hierarchical JSON → 3. Data validation and format compliance verified → 4. File system write operations executed → 5. Persistence confirmation provided to user

info.name: Hybrid Platform Interface
info.description: Cross-platform export interface supporting both web browser downloads and native desktop file dialogs through Tauri platform detection with feature parity across deployment contexts

interfaces.protocol: 1. Export request initiated → 2. Platform context detected (web vs desktop) → 3. Appropriate API selected (Tauri vs Web) → 4. Output formatted and delivered → 5. Platform-specific completion handling executed

info.name: Power Management Interface
info.description: Electrical power interface managing energy consumption across BERT's multi-layered architecture including Rust runtime, Bevy graphics processing, Leptos reactive updates, and Tauri desktop integration

interfaces.protocol: 1. Power requirements assessed for current operations → 2. Component power allocation optimized → 3. Performance scaling applied based on availability → 4. Energy consumption monitored and logged → 5. Efficient power utilization maintained

info.name: Leptos UI Interface
info.description: Reactive user interface supporting bounded entity creation, property editing, and system navigation through type-safe Rust web components with real-time state synchronization

interfaces.protocol: 1. User interaction captured through Leptos components → 2. Event validation and type checking performed → 3. Cross-layer events dispatched to Bevy systems → 4. UI state synchronized with ECS components → 5. Reactive updates rendered to interface

info.name: File Loading Interface
info.description: Hybrid file import interface supporting both HTML5 File API for web context and Tauri native dialogs for desktop with automatic format detection and validation

interfaces.protocol: 1. File selection initiated (Cmd+L or Model Browser) → 2. Platform context detected and appropriate API used → 3. JSON parsing and validation performed → 4. Data model integration executed → 5. ECS world state updated with imported entities

info.name: AI Collaboration Interface
info.description: Natural language processing interface enabling Large Language Model integration for automated system enhancement, content generation, and collaborative modeling through structured API interactions

interfaces.protocol: 1. Natural language input received and parsed → 2. Systems science context and constraints applied → 3. AI processing with domain knowledge integration → 4. Generated content validated and formatted → 5. Results integrated into bounded entity model

info.name: Interactive System Diagram
info.description: Real-time visual representation of bounded entity models rendered through Bevy's Entity-Component-System architecture with interactive components, dynamic hierarchical scaling, and responsive cubic Bézier flow curves

info.name: Processing Heat
info.description: Thermal energy dissipated from computational processes including Rust compilation, Bevy ECS queries, Leptos reactive updates, GPU rendering operations, and memory management during intensive system modeling

info.name: BERT Model File
info.description: System Representation File containing structured bounded entity definitions with hierarchical data model, component relationships, interface specifications, and flow networks. These JSON files implement the Layer 4 System Language framework enabling precise bounded entity representation, version management, and cross-platform compatibility following rigorous systems science principles.

info.name: System Analysis Output
info.description: Processed system analysis including boundary definitions, flow characterizations, hierarchical decompositions, and visual documentation generated through BERT's hybrid architecture with platform-optimized delivery mechanisms

info.name: Electrical Power
info.description: Electrical energy input required for all computational operations including Rust runtime execution, Bevy ECS processing, Leptos UI rendering, Tauri platform integration, and GPU-accelerated graphics with dynamic scaling based on modeling complexity

info.name: System of Interest Data
info.description: Human-provided domain expertise, system specifications, boundary definitions, and modeling objectives that guide the bounded entity reasoning process through BERT's interactive Leptos-based interface

info.name: External Model Data
info.description: Pre-existing bounded entity models, system specifications, and external data files imported through BERT's hybrid loading interface with automatic format detection, validation, and ECS integration

info.name: AI-Enhanced Content
info.description: System Representation enhancement including AI-generated descriptions, analytical insights, domain-specific content, and collaborative modeling suggestions produced through natural language processing with systems science domain expertise
